The weight loss and difficulty in fully emptying bowels further support the diagnosis. The barium enema shows ulceration and narrowing of the right colon, which is consistent with Crohn’s disease. Ulcerative colitis typically involves the rectum and spreads proximally, while Crohn’s disease can involve any part of the gastrointestinal tract from the mouth to the anus. Celiac disease typically presents with malabsorption and a high-fiber diet is not a risk factor. Intestinal carcinoid tumors usually present with flushing and diarrhea, which are not present in this case.
